author: MarkTheWave
title: Request to Fix TwitterMoments and TrendsForYou VoiceOver Accessibility Bug
content:
Unlike in previous versions of the app, in the latest release of Twitter for iOS (v7.9), VoiceOver, Apple’s software screen reading solution for the blind and low vision,  can no longer  access TwitterMoments and the “TrendsForYou” feature of the Twitter service.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:

1.
Make certain that VoiceOver is enabled.  

2.
From within the Twitter for iOS app, select the “Search and Explore” tab, located near the bottom center of the display.  The current headline article will be displayed.  This area of the screen is VoiceOver accessible.  

3.
Either by single-finger swiping from left-to-right or using explore-by-touch, place VoiceOver focus on the “Trends for You” heading, located just above the middle center of the display.  

4.
Now, single-finger swipe from left-to-right in order to read the currently trending article headlines.  In previous versions of the app, the trending article headlines would be read, out loud.  Now, however, swiping from left-to-right results in nothing being read, out loud, even though there are trending article headlines being displayed on the screen.

5.
Either by single-finger swiping from left-to-right or using explore-by-touch, place VoiceOver focus on the “Today’s Moments”.

6.
Now, single-finger swipe from left-to-right in order to read the Twitter Moments article headlines.  In previous versions of the app, the Twitter Moments article headlines would be read, out loud.  Now, however, swiping from left-to-right results in nothing being read, out loud, even though there are Twitter Moments article headlines being displayed on the screen.

I fervently request that this VoiceOver accessibility bug be addressed as soon as possible.

Thank you,

Mark

author: Snape
title: Updated Oct. 11, 2017: it's worse than last update.
content:
I can no longer move/reorder accounts, like I could, yesterday. Plus, there are huge lags, on some accounts. Yes, this is after uninstalling/installing, and then turning my phone off and back on. Is there any beta testing, before new versions are rolled out? It shouldn't be infested with bugs, and lag. Go back to one week ago, please, to version 7.7 or 7.8. Seriously, the last bad update we had, I used to go back to version 6.31.5 (courtesy of downloading it from my Mac), and it was a huge improvement in functionality, despite the giant step backward. It was worth it. Now I can’t even do that anymore, thanks to the bloody update on my Mac! Also, scrolling back to the top of a thread is a hugely bad idea. If you want to make it so we can toggle between seeing the first tweet or the last, great. Give us the option. 

***
Older review (though still applicable): 

Revert the app to one week ago, and don't touch it. Now, it lags, has fits and coughs, and quits... It's such a pain. I hate guinea-pigging updates. We shouldn't have to delete and reinstall to reset the app for better functionality. 

I chain tweets together, and it's aggravating to be typing along...and have a lag. My fingers keep moving in the hopes that the app will catch up. It does, seconds later, when I should be already on my next tweet.

author: Molotov9
title: Still so much room for improvement.
content: There is no way to select alert notifications for original tweets to not get spammed with banner notifications when accounts retweet or respond to tweets. It\'s crazy just how often the app fails to load tweets over even high speed Wi-Fi. Reporting accounts seems to do little as users posting anti-Semitic and racist garbage with Nazi symbols in their avatar, background, display name and bio are still running amok. There has to be at least minimal effort on Twitter\'s end to explicitly disclose accounts running of scripts or at least partially automated–include a blue \'automated\' badge next to usernames like the verified check. If removing the scripted accounts which make up 15%+ of Twitter is too much of a drop in user activity and scares investors then the very least Twitter can do is allow us to see which accounts are actually operated by real users.

Make certain that VoiceOver is enabled.  

2.
From within the Twitter for iOS app, select the “Search and Explore” tab, located near the bottom center of the display.  The current headline article will be displayed.  This area of the screen is VoiceOver accessible.  

3.
Either by single-finger swiping from left-to-right or using explore-by-touch, place VoiceOver focus on the “Trends for You” heading, located just above the middle center of the display.  

4.
Now, single-finger swipe from left-to-right in order to read the currently trending article headlines.  In previous versions of the app, the trending article headlines would be read, out loud.  Now, however, swiping from left-to-right results in nothing being read, out loud, even though there are trending article headlines being displayed on the screen.

The only workaround, at this time, is for a VoiceOver user to continue swiping from left-to-right, until VoiceOver focus lands on the “Show More” button, the activation of which, will result in a VoiceOver accessible list of trending article headlines.  

I fervently request that this VoiceOver accessibility bug be addressed as soon as possible.

Thank you,

Mark

author: TamDanny
title: Solid official app, hope to see it grow further
content:
As I\'m starting to use Twitter once again, I just wanna say that this remains a well-made app for your Twitter needs.
I\'ve tried other apps such as Tweetbot and Twitterific, and while they may offer more functionalities like statistics or customization options, I don\'t really need all those. And things like the simple, modern UI and live updates helps me select this as my go-to app for Twitter.
If there\'s something I really want this app to have is to be able sync your timeline position throughout other devices. It\'s a bit bothersome that I don\'t know where I left off as I check Twitter on my computer or the iPad, or worse, I\'ll be sent to the top of the timeline if enough time has passed. Other Twitter apps, like the ones mentioned above, have this feature (using Tweet Marker), but I really would like to have this feature here.
All in all, solid app. Really hope to see it improve overtime.

author: Juan Guapo
title: Crippled; deleted Apple Watch support.
content:
Twitter is an excellent platform but the experience is marred by awful mobile apps.

First, they killed-off Apple Watch support quietly.

Next, for the iPhone itself, the interface was always a little clunky but the new "interface" they've rolled out is very basic, muted, and in some ways user-hostile. Opening a particular twitter user's page is more-not-less-clicks than it was in the previous update. Drafting a new tweet looks cartoon-like. Yuck.

Lastly, they make it harder to like Twitter with almost every update. Instead of fixing bugs, slimming down the updates, and making the app perform faster/better and more reliably, they add more-and-more bloat. I keep two Twitter-related apps on my iPhone: their website link, and a 3rd party Twitter app (no name, except it rhymes with Terrific). 

I fear Twitter has lost its way.

author: Cheeky-faerie
title: STEP IT UP
content:
Twitter needs to step up its game with pornography. I don\'t even know why they allow it. I set up my twitter so that sensitive content would be hidden, which is a good feature in theory. HOWEVER, the supposed \"sensitive content\" is usually 100% harmless while actual pornographic profiles never seem to be blocked. 
Why do you allow pornographic materials on your site? Just because it\'s too much of a hassle to get rid of? No that can\'t be the case because your constantly hiding INNOCENT PICTURES!!! Y\'all have the time!! I\'d like to not be traumatized by a woman covered in blood penetrating herself with a knife again please. 
And I also don\'t like the idea of a favorite platform of mine promoting the industries that exploit, degrade, and objectify women. So I don\'t see why you can\'t just take down pornographic twitter profiles. Facebook does it. Hell, even Tumblr does a better job at hiding nsfw content. That\'s saying A LOT.

author: Shane B
title: Order by DateTime Descending
content:
What made Twitter great was its simplicity and easy of use to see in real time what is actually going on in the world. On that same note what makes twitter so completely terrible now is that it does nothing but show you what THEY want you to see, as opposed to whatever naturally gets posted at that second. It's impossible now to know if something you keep is seeing is because it is naturally trending or because twitter has chosen to show that topic more often than other topics.  

TL;DR: Twitter decides what information you are ALLOWED to see, as well as what they DON'T want you to see.

author: artkern
title: I wish they would focus more on security...
content:
Even after John Biggs, Matt Honan, Brian Krebs and Thomas Brewster (among countless others) have demonstrated conclusively that SMS as a form of 2-factor is insecure, Twitter INSISTS on forcing you to give your phone number to activate 2-factor, AND EVEN WHEN YOU EXPLICITLY SET UP AN AUTHENTICATOR APP, THEY INSIST IN FORCING YOU TO GET CODES THROUGH TEXT!! That phone number by the way, is the SAME piece of verifying information needed to change the password! So anyone who knows your phone number (which is not a super secure piece of information) could potentially have the keys to the kingdom...
Also, the codes sent by SMS are different than the ones generated by the authenticator app - and both work!?!) Why can’t I decide that I ONLY want 2-factor through an authenticator app?

author: clubside360
title: Return Account to Bottom Bar
content:
Edit: the Account icon on the bottom bar has been removed and now a swipe from the left opens a sidebar. This is far too sensitive and dismissing the bar when holding the iPad one handed is difficult. There was zero reason for this UI change.

I'd also like an option to require a double-tap to drill down on a single tweet. While not horrible compared to some apps unintentional/misread taps happen often enough to allow this option. It's rare I view a single tweet, especially nowadays where few replies are ever actually shown and the few replies not completely hidden require additional taps to display.

---

Twitter's initial design and mission, free speech in SMS-size bites freely available for anyone to read based on their choice, was great. There were many great 3rd-party apps that have long since been shut down but the official app is mostly great, though it's shuffling of the timeline on refresh is annoying.

The two stars are for the service as things stand at the time of this writing: bans over language (particularly to "verified" accounts), missing replies (mostly because of Blocks which should never have been added, Mutes work within the initial design), encouraging "reports" of "bad" tweets over differing opinions, the service is a shell of its mission.

Twitter wonders why growth is stalled. They think "cleaning" things up will work when instead it causes other users to use the service less and warn away new people. You either believe in freedom or you don't. Twitter launched claiming belief, today they represent stifling of speech.

author: Ajakydh120
title: Better than the others
content: I love using Twitter. Yes it definitely does have its hiccups and glitches, but I experience them far less frequently than I do on other social apps. I also like that twitter still keeps things in chronological order and doesn't force an AI on us. Because of this it has become my most used app, I even spend more time reading on twitter than I do watching videos or movies on YouTube or Netflix. Being able to easily click on a hashtag and easily find a place where people are only discussing that topic is great. A lot of the other social apps tend to have very cluttered hashtags so you don't always find what you're looking for. A suggestion would be to allow people to edit tweets even if it's only for a limited amount of time before the tweet becomes permanent. That way people aren't changing their tweets after a lot of people have seen it, but it still gives people the opportunity to fix typos.

author: Luna Lunita Lunera
title: FIX. YOUR. APP.
content:
Stop hiding relevant, one or two star reviews. Stop deleting people\'s one star reviews. Stop using fake profiles to leave fake 5 star \"reviews\". We see you. We know.

Having said that, the ridiculous \"updates\" this app goes through are all pointless. There are no bugs being fixed nor addressed. Each update is worse than the last. This app crashes even more now. I can view tweets for a minute then it crashes and I have to close it, then get back in to view threads, reply tweets or new ones. I\'ve had so many tweets delete on me or never post. Today, a tweet of mine actually posted to my TL but when it crashed 15 seconds later and I closed it, going back into the app I saw my tweet had \"magically\" disappeared. 

Is Twitter doing this on purpose? Is this all just another way to censor people? They sure censor their negative and truthful reviews. 

And before anyone states these issues are due to operator error, I will say I\'ve had this app for a long time. It didn\'t originally perform this way. This was actually an ok app. Now? The worst. Literally, the worst. I use Wi-Fi and Cell data as a backup so it\'s not an internet connection issue. I have a lot of open space of memory on my devices so that is not the issue. This is just a terrible app.

title: Profile button no longer exists but...
content:
That doesn\'t bother me. I knew it was bound to happen. As with the iPhone version, I don\'t have any problems with the layout on the iPad version. As long it cooperates, I\'ll be fine.

Version 7.6 (initial review)

Updated to the latest version on my iPad but I don\'t get the functionality of what I get on my iPhone. I can tell because the profile button is still visible after restarting the app on my iPad 3 times after updating. Doesn\'t affect me in anyway, but it will affect everyone else on the iPad version for those who still want the profile button to stay. I have a feeling that will disappear when the iPad layout becomes similar to the iPhone layout with the profile button disappearing once this functionality is working on the iPad version.

Version 7.0

TBH, after reading all the reviews, I thought I\'m going to hate the new version but I was wrong. Despite that I need to restart the app 2 times after the update but that doesn\'t bother me. The new layout works just fine on both my iPhone 6 & iPad Mini 4 and the profile button stayed on my iPad after the latest update. For those who are still looking for the profile button, the iPad version has it.

author: YahYah24
title: Lists won\'t load
content:
I\'ve seen others commenting on this issue, saying it\'s not a problem.  For me, it\'s a pretty big problem. I use all of my lists every single day and more than half of my lists - my older and more populated lists - cannot be loaded with this new app update. This is ... incredibly inconvenient and I will not be able to use this app now because of it.  I should have given this 1 star, due to the fact that this app has now rendered itself useless to me, but the rest seems to be functional so 2 stars is fair.  It works - I just can\'t use it because its most basic of functions no longer meets my needs.

Why in the world would you (Twitter) encourage the use of lists and then arbitrarily decide on, one of your updates, to deny users access to some (any) of those lists? As a long time Twitter user this move is considered unwise, and discouraging to people who want to use your app.

And now, I need to either find a new app or use the mobile site - which actually allows me to access all of my lists.

Same thing with recommendations in your feed. The thing is,  it seems like it's totally unnecessary.  Why not just leave the app politically neutral and let the user choose who they follow and interact with? Or at least leave your slanted news stories somewhere other than inside the search function.

author: Jo Rayburn
title: High school
content:
Twitter is like being in high school all over again. 

A combination of The Outsiders, Mean Girls, School Ties and Breakfast Club all tied into to one. The proverbial your popular/unpopular high school drama all wrapped up in one. 

True it serves as a platform for voice, but it\'s hinged on it\'s members who are trying to come up with clever euphemisms limited to 140 characters (good or bad) will be liked, shared or responded to. Are you liked and retweeted hangs in anticipation of the one who sent it. 

The 140 character catch by Twitter is \"Your Cut Off\", say what you will and Enough. But in 140 characters humanity has been challenged and now the world\'s peace may be compromised.

author: AndYeahThat\'sPrettyMuchIt
title: Cannot See Who Liked Tweets
content:
After this last update, Twitter no longer wants to show me when somebody I follow liked a tweet. It\'ll say \"Johnny Appleseed and 5 others liked this\" above a tweet, and I\'ll click on it to see, but instead it opens a list of people who liked that tweet, but that list only shows about a hundred people, and doesn\'t include the person I KNOW liked it. 
This may seem small, but it makes twitter frustrating to use. I want to know who I\'m following that is liking certain tweets. It changes my opinion of them, and is a very important feature.

author: Lightning 2
title: Great way to keep up with political news!
content:
I enjoy POTUS multiple tweets to get his message out. I enjoy friendly banter & reading folk\'s frustrations too. It\'s a good App to keep current on news. Watch out for crazies, porn & fakes. 

I like the challenge to keep my comments succinct.  While I thoroughly enjoy the roller coaster of laughing, crying, being amazed by tweets, I prefer clean speech. I do question why Twitter removes some profane comments but not others.

Something annoying, I find, is to receive messages from those impersonating someone. One pastor has 7 fakes duplicating his twitter page!? The blue check mark system is helpful but not all Twitter accounts use the blue check mark. This issue is causing me to consider giving up on Twitter.

author: JAHNTRAN
title: A once great app has fallen
content: Twitter is extremely biased against US President Donald Trump. Not even the userbase, but the company itself. Constantly censoring right-wing opinions, the designers of this app have opted to promote almost exclusively extreme leftist opinions in its new Buzzfeed copy: Twitter Moments. Two years ago when this feature was introduced, it was optional and nobody ever used it. I guess they caught on, because now instead of being able to search on any of the apps 4 tabs, you have to go to the one which has Twitter Moments on it in order to look anything up on the app. I wouldn\'t have a problem with this, but often it is faked news. I\'m not just throwing that term around either. Just yesterday they published an \"article\" about how President Trump apparently did not denounce white nationalists and neo-Nazis, and how reactions to that were \"mixed\". The problem with that, however, is that he actually did denounce those two hate groups, and Twitter refuses to retract this false headline. The people in charge of Twitter Moments are also known racists, with an article popping up every now and then about \"removing whites from Hollywood\" or \"what would your favorite tv shows be like if there were no white straight men?\" Seems a bit... bigoted... wouldn\'t you say? This app would be much better, maybe one of the best if they stopped trying to constantly bow down to the left and at least put up an attempt to seem unbiased. Sadly though, they never have to since their actions have no consequences, since they have a monopoly on microblogging. Oh well!

title: What's up with Twitter moments
content:
They don't seem to be moments at all. I like twitter for news and what's happening. Sometimes it seems like what's trending on Twitter moments is random.  

Past review:
Now that there are more trending topics the descriptions are very vague. It's a waste of time to even Check out what's trending. 

I also work long hours and when I check my Twitter feed I often find a box the asking if I'd like to see more tweets.  On either side of the tweets will be many hours apart.  While I appreciate the idea that I might not want to scroll thru all the tweets I missed, I find it frustrating that if I hit the box it takes me to a random place in my tweets.  I wish there was an option to stay or move forward.

Twitter is s great place to keep in touch with news from my state to the world!

And I have gotten tired of this. I have sprit, and good signal. Everything is fine but it continues to do this. So if I cannot find a solution to this I will have to stop using the app for my iPhone 6s. They don't really have many proper ways to contact them about this issue. Please if anyone else has this issue or knows what to do or any suggestions PLEASE LET ME KNOW! This is a great app that's why I'm leaving 4 stars. Honestly that's my only problem with the app is I cannot use it. Thanks.

author: arcedwj
title: Twitter Policy
content:
Censorship is rarely positive. Twitter's policies are archaic and very poorly administered. Sadly, it really is the only game in town because Facebook is virtually useless.

To give someone a "timeout" because some whiny Twit (pun intended) is offended by a post without giving the alleged offender a detailed reason, the name of the cowardly whiner, or a chance to respond is typical of the politically correct crowd, but it really has no place in social media. Hopefully, competitors will evolve.

On another note, Twitter is far too lenient with its policies on advertising (promotion). Too many advertisements, and too much schilling by news media pretending to be reporting news when the article is nothing but an advertisement.

author: KioFoxy
title: Twitter, we need to talk.
content:
Twitter was a great platform, but now it\'s just ok. There are many things that need to be changed or improved on Twitter.
1. Have real people on the support team. Twitter\'s support bot isn\'t useful at all.
2. Have tweets in chronological order.
The timeline is all messed up for me and sometimes I don\'t even see tweets from people I follow.
3. Explain exactly what changes on the updates.
\"Minor bug fixes and improvements\" do not justify a 200MB update. Explaining what got changed or what has been fixed will.
4. Add an edit button.
When a tweet gets made, the user should have five minutes to edit it so they don\'t have to delete and make the tweet again.
5. Increase the character limit to 200 characters 
The amount of characters we have for each tweet (140) isn\'t enough, having 200 would be much better.
6. Stop shadowbanning people 
If you need to ban someone, please tell them what they did wrong, how they can prevent it from happening in the future, and how long the ban will last.
7. Have an option to turn off the \"What your friends\" like and the \"This tweet may contain sensitive content\" features.
They are both really annoying and don\'t \"improve\" the Twitter experience at all.
8. Bring back the old design 
The only design made it much easier to have a square icon and it made it much easier to get to my profile.
So this is what I\'d change on Twitter, if these get changed I\'ll edit my review and adjust the rating accordingly, but for right now I give it a one-star rating.

The only way to get rid of it is if I go back into the app. This has been happening for a while now, but in the past it was so infrequent that I didn't mind. Now it happens all the time, and even several times in a row so that I am going back into the app multiple times to rid it of the notification. It's annoying and frustrating, and I'm considering deleting twitter if it isn't fixed. Please, please fix it!

author: Brewster71
title: Just give me my timeline in chronological order like we all want it.
content:
Twitter\'s motto should be  \"We\'ll let you easily engage but make disengagement twice as hard\". It seems to be a really difficult concept for Twitter to just provide you with the tweets of those you follow, in chronological order, and not add content or change you place in the timeline or auto refresh and make you lose your place. Why?

Other glaring problems: 

1/ You can\'t unfollow someone without having to confirm every time. But you can follow them without having to confirm. Annoying.

2/ Twitter has been around for what, ten years? And we still can\'t mute someone for just a few hours (say, because we don\'t care about that ball game they\'re tweeting about). Nope. We have to mute them then remember to go back and UNMUTE them. So basic, but so broken. 

3/ Stop friggin forcing tweets into my timeline that aren\'t from people that I follow. It\'s really really intrusive. I don\'t care if John and Sally \"liked\" Jim\'s tweet. If I did, I\'d let you know. 

4/ Stop with the \"in case you missed it\" summary. I\'ve clicked \"see less often\" twenty times and disabled \"show me the best tweets first\" but you still seem to think I care if I missed someone\'s tweet. I do not. 

5/ Basically, give us control over our timelines instead of passive-aggressively force-feeding us content we didn\'t ask for.

author: Eliot R
title: Updated: fixes address serious annoyances
content:
Twitter has added back the \"see less often\" buttons that address my frustrations (below). Now happy to give 5 stars. Still plenty of room for improvement, but this is probably my most used app and outside of the below frustrations, I enjoy the experience. 

PREVIOUSLY: I passionately dislike the ICYMI and Follow recommendations that get inserted into the timeline. I used to always dismiss them and that brought me some sanity. Now that button is gone and I\'m stuck with these additions constantly showing up in the timeline regardless if I had last used the app only a few minutes prior. The app is making progress elsewhere (thanks Safari View Controller), but this change will seriously make me move to third party apps.

author: starwars_taz
title: Really?
content:
Now there's a problem with DMs. The check marks don't change color when a DM is read. Please fix this.

Please bring back the ability to minimize the "In Case You Missed It" & "Who to Follow" sections. They are a waste of a space & sections that I don't care about. They take away space from the current tweets & make it harder to see them. I liked being able to minimize these sections & choosing to not have them show up so much. Now, I can't do that. Please change this back.

Edit: The "In Case You Missed It" section not only shows tweets that you might have missed, it also shows tweets that you might have already seen.

Edit 2: I found out from one of the accounts that I tweet regularly that my tweets are not always showing up. I have to resend most of my tweets to that account. Is this because of the "In Case You Missed It" feature?

Edit 3: For the "Who to Follow" feature, I don't want to see more. I want to see less or none at all.

Edit 4: Thanks for taking care of the issue with the "ICYMI" feature. Now, can you please put my tweets through to another account's TL? As I stated earlier, the owner of the account has informed me that my tweets don't always show up on the TL, even though the account is always tagged in them. When they do show up, it's because the account is on & active. Please fix this. It's been like this for over a year.

Edit 5: On my second account, I'm getting notifications from accounts that I don't follow. I have this option turned on so that I don't get notifications from accounts that I don't follow. Please fix this.

author: Bella Jaymes Cullen
title: Needs more improvements!!!!
content:
1- Make the new look automatic so when you uninstall & reinstall the new look is there right when we open the app!! 

2- Give us the edit button so we can edit our tweets if we messed them up in the first place! 

3- Go back to using the old web service instead of using Safari it\'s annoying cause we can already use the Safari app we don\'t need it in this app! 

4- Give us some more tweet characters not all of us want to read essays all the time we would rather have a way to finish our thought instead of being cut off right when we use the 140 characters up!!! 

5- Give us a way to zoom in or out so we can get closer or not closer pics so we don\'t have to exit out of the app & use our camera app to get the perfect picture!!!

6- Make it so when we do slid over to the profile that we don\'t lose our place at what we were looking at before instead of losing our place!! 

7- Fix it so that the timeline doesn\'t always restart every 5 seconds or when someone tweets something new that it would restart & we would lose our place it needs to stop & be fixed ASAP!!!

If y\'all make these few changes I\'ll be inclined to give you 5 stars until then y\'all will only get 1 star from me!! 🙏🙂

author: Lunch Duty
title: In Case You Missed My One Star Review
content:
In case you missed it, I hate the In Case You Missed It feature. I think everyone does. It used to be a nuisance that I could get rid off. However, even though I routinely selected \"I don\'t like this,\" Twitter decided to make it a permanent feature. I now have to see a bunch of tweets again and receive news or jokes that are from conversations that happened a day ago. I now have to check when something was tweeted because I can\'t even trust that what I\'m looking at is recent.

This feature has made Twitter more cumbersome and inconvenient. Why doesn\'t Twitter understand what people like about Twitter?

author: Luke Bigsby
title: Chronological Order + more
content:
I\'ve never written an app review before but I want Twitter to know how much I hate what they\'re doing.

This is my fav social media platform. Unfortunately I now must use a 3rd party app to get things the way I want.

1) I want my tweets in chronological order. I stay in the loop that way even when I haven\'t been on in a day or so.

2) The \"In case you missed it\" feature is now not optional so I miss out on much more and can\'t follow stories

3) Leave my timeline where it is when I leave the app. When I come back to it I have to scroll for minutes now just to get back to where I left off in order to catch up on my TL

4) Did I mention I want my DARN tweets in chronological order?!

author: Zarafa
title: Best not to update Twitter
content:
I wrote review below, thinking my complaints were re most recent update. I now realize it was an update in June & the description of the update sort of described the change they were making. Nonetheless, I hate it. 

I just wish that Donald Trump would download the update too. If he hated the update as much as I do, he might stop Tweeting. And the world would be a better place. 

Twitter said this was a \"minor\" update, so I updated. 

In fact, it is an update that rearranges the interface. Most annoyingly, it has moved Lists around so that it is no longer possible to be reading a series of tweets from your lists, while reading your timeline and switch easily between the two. 

That makes it much harder to organize what you\'re reading instead of having to deal with Twitter\'s algorithms ideas about what you want to read. 

THIS UPDATE REALLY STINKS!!

author: starwars_taz
title: Really?
content:
Please bring back the ability to minimize the "In Case You Missed It" & "Who to Follow" sections. They are a waste of a space & sections that I don't care about. They take away space from the current tweets & make it harder to see them. I liked being able to minimize these sections & choosing to not have them show up so much. Now, I can't do that. Please change this back.

Edit: The "In Case You Missed It" section not only shows tweets that you might have missed, it also shows tweets that you might have already seen.

Edit 2: I found out from one of the accounts that I tweet regularly that my tweets are not always showing up. I have to resend most of my tweets to that account. Is this because of the "In Case You Missed It" feature?

Edit 3: For the "Who to Follow" feature, I don't want to see more. I want to see less or none at all.

Edit 4: Thanks for taking care of the issue with the "ICYMI" feature. Now, can you please put my tweets through to another account's TL? As I stated earlier, the owner of the account has informed me that my tweets don't always show up on the TL, even though the account is always tagged in them. When they do show up, it's because the account is on & active. Please fix this. It's been like this for over a year.

Edit 5: On my second account, I'm getting notifications from accounts that I don't follow. I have this option turned on so that I don't get notifications from accounts that I don't follow. Please fix this.

author: Thecove
title: Twitter listened re In Case You Missed It
content:
8/2/2017 - Give Twitter credit, they actually listened and brought back the ability to dismiss "In Case You Missed It" and other misc section that were being put into you feed and ruining the timeline. Twitter is getting back to being a good source of information presented in an actual timeline. I'm cautiously upgrading my rating of the current version to 3 stars and will continue to upgrade the closer the app gets back to being a true timeline. 

Twitter was always a good source to see things / events / news in a fairly accurate timeline. Its important in this day and age to see the latest topics and follow along chronologically. The latest update destroyed any possibility of that and now the "ICYMI" makes your feed impossible to read and you can't dismiss it. It will force Tweets into your feed from a wide variety of times that makes the feed impossible to follow. When you use Twitter to follow current news and topics, the new "can't dismiss" ICYMI breaks Twitter and turns it into a jigsaw puzzle. This is NOT what you want from a social media app. Please fix it Twitter"

7/24/2017 : The latest update changes nothing, ICYMI still jumbles the timeline, really breaking the purpose of the Twitter app. After years of happy use, my rating remains a 1 star. Please fix it Twitter.

author: gardevoirite
title: Seriously hard to do anything
content:
Innovation is good and all but that's pretty much only gonna work if what you've "innovated" is more efficient or better for the user in ANY way. I'm coming back to Twitter and I would have never known about how to move around the app if it hadn't been for all the negative reviews listing all of the problems with the app. I couldn't even find my own profile. Twitter needs to stream line its features and think how a user would when it wants to update. Right now a downgrade to less complications seems like a pretty good idea. Basically this app is like an infomercial, trying to fix problems that don't exist by making them harder.

Twitter's organization system is definitely not new user friendly, either. At least give users the option to have tweets appear in the timeline chronologically instead of trying to calculate how likely it is a user has seen a post and also making sure they seen the most popular posts. That's how you drive new users out very easily.

Anyone who has worked on those features was seriously overthinking it

author: Phil Grad
title: In Case You Missed It has me thinking of leaving
content:
It used to be annoying that \"show me this less often\" was the closest you could get to \"don\'t show me this garbage I never asked for and never want to see again.\"

Now, not only is the In Case You Missed It section permanent, it is even worse than before. They basically guarantee there will be tweets you \"missed\" by pulling tweets
out of your feed so that they ONLY appear in the ICYMI section. Of course, this means that these tweets are not only out of chronology now, but often they are lacking context provided by other tweets. There are hidden among Tweets yoy have already seen (if you read your entire feed as I do), and tweets you will see again after scrolling above the ICYMI section (how can I MISS a tweet I haven\'t had the change to get to yet?).

Even if they were to stop yanking tweets out of order for this section I don\'t want to see, the problem remains that I don\'t want this section and have no way to opt out (even theoretically opt out as with the \"show me less often\" option which seemed
more decorative than actually functional--I still saw things I opted to see less often quite often).

I love Twitter, but this is ruining my experience. I am aggravated every time I see it, which is most times I check the app. Being infuriated several times a day is not an acceptable experience for me. If this isn\'t changed soon, I will regrettably have to leave Twitter--I will miss it a lot, but it\'s not worth the irritation caused by pointless and infuriating design changes.

author: mustyMONARCH
title: Fake trending topics
content:
When I began using Twitter years ago, it was a place to go and see what people were actually talking about the most. Now, not so much. 

Trending topics were completely organic, uncontrolled and not guided toward a narrative. Now, it's not unusual to see topics with nine tweets trending at number one(usually heavily towards one side of politics). It doesn't matter what side of the political isle you lean towards, we should all be outraged by FAKE trends. People being banned because they say one thing and others being applauded for saying the same thing but for the opposing side. I'm not very political but this is disgusting. 

That is why I no longer tweet. I just check in to see what my favorite people are saying and check out. Twitter is supposed to be a place where EVERYONE has a voice. Regardless of what you believe in. 

1/5 stars.

author: arcedwj

Censorship is rarely positive. Twitter's policies are archaic and very poorly administered. Sadly, it really is the only game in town because Facebook is virtually useless.

To give someone a "timeout" because some whiny Twit (pun intended) is offended by a post without giving the alleged offender a detailed reason, the name of the cowardly whiner, or a chance to respond is typical of the politically correct crowd, but it really has no place in social media. Hopefully, competitors will evolve.

author: Encantadaa.tumblr
title: It was great until recently
content:
I used to have no complaints about this app, but now I\'m more annoyed than anything. Within the past few days, \"in case you missed it\" tweets, which used to be a thing I could dismiss, have now become mandatory for me to see. And most of the time, they\'re tweets I already have seen. If they\'re not, Twitter often chooses to pull a random tweet out of a thread someone wrote, so what I see there makes no sense... and then when I scroll through my timeline to find the rest of the thread, that one tweet is absent, because it was in the ICYMI section. It\'s incredibly annoying. I HATE it. I want to be able to dismiss the ICYMI section again. Did I mention that I hate it?

Another thing I don\'t like is being forced to see tweets that I don\'t follow because someone I do follow liked the tweet. Often, I know who the person in question is, and I don\'t follow them for a reason. I do not want to be forced to see tweets from people I don\'t follow. 

It\'s bizarre that neither of these things affect me when I use Twitter from my computer-- only the app. It\'s making me want to delete the app and only use Twitter from my computer at home. That\'s how much I hate it.

author: Barneyandfriendz
title: In Case You Missed it + Notification Clutter
content:
Remember when you had the option to \"see less often\" when Twitter inserted \"in case you missed it, \"liked by [a user you follow]\", and \"who to follow\"? Pepperidge Farm remembers. Now you\'re forced to have this garbage clutter up your timeline. 

On top of that, as of July 28, 2017, i\'m getting actual notifications about people I follow liking tweets. To be fair, the \"see less often\" option is there for now, but we\'ll see how long that lasts since they removed the option to hide all of the timeline clutter.

90% of the reason I use Twitter is because it\'s so much cleaner than Facebook. I loved being able to only see tweets from people I followed on my timeline (and not their likes or Twitter\'s recommendations), but I guess their crack marketing team decided Twitter\'s recent user decline was because the site wasn\'t cluttered enough or something. Ugh.

author: OMFGrant
title: So Many Problems...Worst Version Yet
content:
Twitter please:

1. Get rid of "Who to Follow" and "In Case You Missed It"
2. Put the profile button back in the bottom right

1. These features make my timeline unbearably cluttered. If I'm not following someone, 99% of the time I DO NOT WANT TO FOLLOW THEM. I don't need recommendations for that, I know who I want to follow and who I do not want to follow.

I didn't miss any tweets. If I didn't see a tweet because I wasn't logged in, that's fine, I don't need to see it!! Don't put it further up on my timeline because I wasn't logged in 8 hours ago!! I use twitter to see what's happening IN THE MOMENT. So what good does it do for me that someone tweeted about a topic 13 hours ago and I'm seeing it now. ENOUGH.

2. As someone who uses several different profiles, it is so frustratingly annoying to click the current profile icon, wait for the menu to slide, click an incredibly small sized profile button, wait for the menu to slide, then have to slide the menu over again, and THEN click the current profile's icon in order to see what the latest activity is on this profile before deciding your next move. Even if I just had one profile this format would be frustrating. I just want to glance at my profile to see the latest activity (I.e. Have I tweeted recently? How well is my latest tweet doing? Should I wait for it to slow down before my next? Etc.) This format is so time consuming for a method that should be quick since the usual goal is just a short glance.

I've never written a review for any app before this, so that should tell you how strongly I feel about this, as well as many others.

author: JayyTownn
title: Go back to before!
content:
This new swipe to the right to bring up your profile is super annoying and incredibly inefficient. Just put the profile icon back in the twitter deck where it used to be. It\'s stupid to have to slide to the right and click on \"profile\" just to be able to see your own tweets, favorites, etc. There was literally not one thing wrong with the way it was before. It was faster and better. If I\'m reading a conversation and want to chime in or respond, I know have no way of getting to my own profile without leaving the conversation that I currently have up. Before the pointless update I could easily just cloak my profile in the dock and  see everything I\'d written or favorited, etc. Now the only way to do that is by leaving what you\'re currently reading/viewing, which isn\'t even worth it since you won\'t be able to pick back up where you left off. The new update makes people not even try to communicate with each other for fear of losing where they were in a conversation or thread. It\'s also tedious, annoying, and unnecessary. 

If anything you should have to swipe right to access your DM\'s, not your own profile. That would\'ve been a much smarter move. But the way you have it now makes people hate using the app because again, it\'s tedious, annoying, and unnecessary.

author: Bookworm Expatriot
title: New app is okay, but...
content:
The updated placement of the share/retweet/like/message icons as part of the tweets is visually distracting. Before, when they were closer together to one another, and slightly smaller, they created a "visual chunk" that acted as an extension of the tweet. Now they seem like a whole row between tweets (rather than an extension of a tweet), especially because they're so close to the line that separates tweets. 

Also, the avatars are too large and the names of the people I follow are too small. With as many people as I follow, and as often as they change their avatars, I don't rely on their avatars to see who wrote a tweet, but rather their name. Also, needs more visual space between user name and tweet... the two run together and it makes reading the actual tweet not difficult!

C'mon guys, I thought the goal of updates is to make things better. Don't make a visual changes just for the sake of change, unless you're actually going to make things better!

Pass these notes along to your UX/UI people and tell them they can do a better job than this.

author: ladycovington
title: Could use a huge update
content:
It used to be the case where every time I opened the app, it would show me the last tweets I had seen, so I could just keep scrolling up from the oldest to the newest. Now, when I open the app, it jumps to the newest tweet first, and when I scroll down, there's a bar to show me the last tweets I viewed. 

Additionally, after a long time of being able to dismiss features I didn't like ("in case you missed it" for example), this is now a permanent feature that also reorders my timeline while I'm sleeping. If you're going to make something a permanent feature, don't give me a choice to submit my feedback against it for two years first. 

I'd like to be able to choose for myself which way I want to scroll through my timeline, thank you very much. I don't mind the bar telling me what I last viewed, but I don't like having to scroll through everything new to find it. I think it is way more attractive to have infinite customizable options, rather than forcing everyone to adjust to one method every new update.

author: Bring Back Great iOS 6 Design
title: Latest design update turned me from a Twitter LOVER/avid user to disgusted/reluctant user & avoider
content:
I manage 10 professional Twitter accounts and two personal accounts, with more than 45,000 followers, and have been on Twitter for eight years. Over those years Twitter has been getting better and better and I have become a more avid and happy user all the time. UNTIL THIS MOST RECENT DESIGN UPDATE, WHICH IS ATROCIOUS.

I haven't rated an app or written a review in about two years, but this design update is so horrible I felt compelled to go out of my way to let Twitter know just how horrifically bad it is, how much it ruins my user experience, and how much it makes me hate Twitter and my iPad Twitter app, both of which I used to LOVE and use constantly.

---------- 

NEW DESIGN ISSUES: 
(Just a few of the many, but I don't have all day to write this review.)

1) The round user icons are terrible. 10 out of the 12 accounts I manage have text on their icons that was created for SQUARE icons. Now the text cannot be fully read, as the round icons cut it off on the four corners. So now I have to redo 10 icons and squeeze all of the text into a smaller space so it can hopefully be seen and no longer cut off. (Or leave the icons with unreadable, cut off, and confusing, text, as they are now.) Thanks Twitter! :-(

2) The new options below a tweet are confusing and annoying. The "reply" option looks like a thought bubble or a quote indication. It does not in any way indicate "replies." I feel like if I click on it I should see all of the quotes of the tweet.

3) The tweets that are replies to other tweets now more prominently display who they are replying to above the tweet in a bigger sized font, which looks like it is now part of the tweet, and is distracting from the ACTUAL tweet. Also there is now less contrast in the color between the text of who the tweet is replying to and the tweet text itself, making it all turn into one big confusing blob of unreadable text. Please fix this!

4) You changed the color scheme or schemes that I was using, and the new colors look awful, and the app doesn't seem to provide any way of changing them back.

5) The new color scheme has less of a contrast between the text of a tweet and the links and hashtags than previously. This leads to them all blending into each other and all looking like a big unreadable blob, instead of previously, when you could clearly see the text as different from the hashtags and links. Extremely annoying and non-user friendly! 

6) The new "thin line"  design of the settings icon and other icons that are no longer solid, are just copying other designs from other companies which I hate, and they look ugly and annoying. One of the reasons I liked Twitter was because the design WASN'T like those others that use that horrible design. Now you just look like conformists who don't care about good design, but instead just follow the herd and use an ugly design just because others do. Pathetic.

7) So many things I click on in the app are now all jerky and bounce around the screen. Very annoying.

---------- 

OTHER ISSUES:
(Only a couple of the many, because of limited time and energy to deal with this.)

1) There is still no way to see only the QUOTE TWEETS of a tweet, whether one's own tweet or another's tweet. In the notifications there is only the ALL or MENTIONS. The MENTIONS used to include quote tweets, but that useful feature was removed. Please either put the quote tweets back into replies/mentions, or create a separate tab in the notifications for quote tweets. That will allow a user to see who quoted their own tweets more easily. But that still won't allow someone to see who quoted OTHER people's tweets. So please provide an option below any tweet, to see who QUOTED that tweet. 

2) On iOS for iPad, there seems to be no way to reverse the design to the previous one, or go back to a previous version of the app. If there is I've missed it, so please inform me if I am incorrect about this. Thanks.

---------- 

Twitter might wonder, "What about all those great new options that we added? Why aren't you acknowledging THEM and don't you appreciate them?" NO. None of them matter to me at all or improve my user experience in any way.

I could have spent all the time writing this review using Twitter itself, which is what I would have usually been doing during this time. But because the UI design is now so bad, I've now switched to complaining about Twitter, and reading others' complaints about Twitter (as therapy to deal with my rage, disappointment and upset), instead of actually using Twitter. 

Hopefully Twitter will listen to the feedback of their users who used to love them, and change back the design, or at least change it to something that isn't horrifically bad and so very non-user-friendly. :-(

title: In Case You Missed My One Star Review
content:
In case you missed it, I had the In Case You Missed It feature. I think everyone does. It used to be a nuisance that I could get rid off. I now have to see a bunch of tweets again and receive news or jokes that are from conversations that happened a day ago. author: murdur-raven
title: The timeline is beyond annoying
content:
So now my timeline is not an actual timeline.  If it was an actual timeline, it\'d be in order.  Now it\'s a random assortment of tweets sent out from...whenever the hell time they were tweeted, in random order.  That ain\'t a timeline, kids.  

Also, it\'s no longer really MY timeline since they are throwing in stuff from accounts I don\'t follow.  Now, I get ads, obnoxious but they gotsta make money.  But it\'s not just ads popping up, it\'s just random crap they \"think I might like.\"  

The \"in case you missed it\" is pointless and takes up way too much room in the feed.  If I care about missing a tweet, I\'d just look up the accounts.  And I never care that much.  

This kind of BS is why I\'m getting fed up with Facebook and now I know when I finally delete FB, I am definitely not heading to Twitter as my main social media platform.

author: The Original T-Time
title: Yes, Twitter.
content:
I am so glad the me button for my own profile is back in the corner! 
Now, with the previous update, I ended up not getting any notifications as time went on (for example the app and the online version wouldn\'t show I had 5 notifications when I logged in...I had to go to the notifications section and refresh it or it would already be loaded, but not show what was new). Also, I wasn\'t able to like pinned tweets without it somehow getting un-liked. 
I hope this update fixed all that...I\'ll be keeping an eye out! 

You might as well put an unsend button for the dms like Instagram did, since they are your competitor and people seem to keep complaining about that.

Best of luck, I hope you keep improving! I love using Twitter!

Never mind...somehow it\'s back to the ugly way it was and the me profile button is gone again. Ugh. Back to the apparently new ugly way it is. So annoyed. Thought it was fixed and I don\'t know how I got the old version at first. Ugh. Back to one star...

title: I did not "Miss It"
content:
Twitter seems to love its new feature "In Case You Missed It" so much that it's willing to take tweets from 3 and 5 minutes ago and clump them into the pile of tweets I've already read and ask me if I've already seen them.  For a while it let you select an option to "see this less" but that didn't seem to do anything and now it's gone. 

If you let me read the tweets in order, I definitely won't miss anything. No need for the obnoxious box of old tweets and ones from 45 seconds ago mixed together. That only makes my timeline confusing and annoying. 

Also bring back the profile along the bottom and make the pictures square again. It makes it look like you're copying Instagram.

author: towce
title: An actual Communicator
content:
I was never a fan of social media, had myspace and at one point, Facebook of course, but a liking to them never arose. Based on both of those examples, after I turned 20, the determination to never have any type of social media took over me. I almost hated the fact that they existed. My mind emphasized feeling like it dehumanized us. 
Growing up in a town named Ayotla (93-2001) it wasn't strange for houses not to have access to a phone. Because of this it forced us, no, it enabled us to go out if we wanted to communicate and inform ourselves... Based on this is why I had the perspective of annoyance towards social media.

For a long time, I kept that perspective. That is, until my brother Frito, really introduced me to Twitter! 

It's been a little over a year now (I remember getting an anniversary notification not to long ago) and all I can say after all this time is that, I love it. It works for me because it allows me to inform and communicate without any of the nuisances that most social media seem to have. 

If you feel or felt like that at one point in your life... Tweet.

author: S Camp
title: Updated review (7/16/17)
content:
(7-17/17)
Crashes all the time when viewing images. Memory overrun on normal use.
Very poor image render speed.

V. 6.25.1
Works quite well but it is confusing on Twitter's purpose as a social platform for IOS now that the Discover and Activity functions are gone from this release. It is very annoying not seeing friend activity to find new people to follow and chat with.
Only one true issue is that the new boxes (shared information within the tweet) look like the styling was not finished on them. The spacing/padding needs to be tightened and it needs to have a little more clean UI look like the rest of the app.

V. 6.16.1
Working good except for crashing (or send error) when trying to send a tweet with an image that was captured with burst mode. 

Version 6.13.3:
Suuuuuuuper buggy. Starting to look like it was not bug tested fully on this latest release before it was published.
- Image rotation is broken when viewing images
- Notifications are super flaky
- App badges are acting up and do not associate with what it should show in the app.

Version 5.1.3 review:
The app is incredibly slow to launch on an iPhone 5. The allow others to DM you was a nice opt-in feature before you just disabled it.
The fonts used between digest view and single view are not even remotely the same.
The location nag on every new twitter post is so incredibly annoying.
Other than those obvious issues, it is looking a little more polished.

Version 5.0.2 review:
Conversations within clicking on a tweet are still broken. Mobile twitter website is working better than the app :-/

Version 5.0.1 review:
Just as the app was getting to be a great app, here came another update and made it unusable again.
The timeline is jacked. Tweets show up all over the timeline without any coherent sorting.
When you open a tweet that is part of a conversation, 90% of the time none of the other  tweets within the conversation show up.
Sometimes refreshing the timeline on 3G or 4G can be sufferingly slow. 
It is hit an miss whether you will see an image without having to click on the link within the tweet.

Other than those problems (which is pretty much the entire functionality bit) it operates ok :-/

Version 3.0 review:
I am not sure what happened to the quality of this app. The previous version (v3..) was amazing!
Now for what's wrong:
Instapaper no longer works or is even evident of how to use. Swipe to reply is no longer there. Translations is a pain because it is GONE. The discover icon is almost as cluttered as a Microsoft word toolbar. The fact that you can only add one picture now per tweet is very annoying. The fact that the web interface lets you view conversations but the iPhone app does not - leads me to believe that this app was rushed to deployment.
Overall,
The new look is nice visually but on the functionality end compared to previous versions is very lacking.

author: Devin Austra
title: Twitter used to be an equalizer...
content:
My favorite thing about Twitter in the past was how no one was given preference in how their tweets were displayed. It was chronological order and that was it. Now, I see replies from "checked" people first, suggested tweets I usually don't care about, and hidden replies.
Put it back the way it was. In order by time, no "in case you missed it", no bumping replies by certain people to the top, no secretly promoting certain political ideologies or agendas. 

Sure we'd see many replies we didn't like, but it was far more equal. That's what made Twitter great when it first started.

author: E.B. Q.
title: Out of Sync
content:
Why is this out of sync with Twitter on the web or on the desktop app TweetDeck?  I\'ve turned of the idiotic \"Best Tweets\" feature, so it should show exactly the same chronological order here as elsewhere—but it doesn\'t.

It\'s also usually two to three hours behind the web.  How can that be?

And it also will not display all my notifications.  It misses messages, direct messages, mentions, and retweets . . . and it never refreshes to get what it missed in that column.

I\'ve deleted and reloaded the app, but it still is running behind and missing mentions.

If you want this app (and, indeed, Twitter itself) to be a place where people can get up-to-the-second comments on news, people, and (of course) Shakespeare, fix this app!

author: DinaLove
title: No longer a regular part of my life
content:
Twitter was my one-stop shop for news, sound bites, and keeping up with what my friends & colleagues were doing. I left Facebook years ago and, since I found Twitter, I hadn\'t looked back...until recently. 

As an entrepreneur, I\'m still finding Twitter extremely beneficial in making connections with folks in my field--moreso than LinkedIn since Twitter is an open forum; I don\'t need to have a person confirmed as a personal connection on Twitter before corresponding with him or her--but these last updates have been a little hard to work with/around. 

I\'m echoing everything most everyone else on here is saying, notably, my drafts are gone and I don\'t like the new way the \"Moments\" feed is set up. 

I never understand why some apps have to fix what\'s not broken, but I\'m definitely not visiting Twitter as often as I used to.

author: itabmedia
title: Swipe Back Removed?!! Please add back!!
content:
Wow! This version is a nice surprise. After over a year of posting suggestions in my reviews, Twitter has finally come around. Using customer feedback in this version, it is really improved. The Twitter app is back to being my main client. 

Nice QOL additions added! Swipe back from link and Safari view controller were the two features I wish this app had. Now they are added! The Twitter team also made the app more fluid and polished. Everything works and looks great!

The only request I have left would be an option to disable all ads via an IAP, low monthly subscription maybe? I would gladly pay $1.99 per month to not have to see promoted tweets. As of now, I block these accounts. This is quite annoying to have to do every 8-10 tweets. Please follow the Reddit app and add a way to remove these ads. 

Thanks very much for all the improvements. Much appreciated!

author: Evilipoo
title: Stop changing for the sake of change
content:
This app was great a few versions ago. I could check out Moments and find funny or relevant stuff. 
Then, they buried Moments somewhere and I did not have time to look for it. 
Now, clicking on a link opens the link just fine, but it is hard to back out. "Done" is hidden in the upper left corner and it does not always appear when you want it to. Additionally, if you follow a link within a link, it is difficult to get back to the original link because the back button disappears and does not always reappear. 
Lastly, I am now seeing notifications for stupid stuff like when someone I follow re-tweets something. Ugh. So now I have to modify my notification settings and then I may not see what I really WANT to be notified about. 
I think the answer might just be to move twitter to my last screen and ignore it.

author: Alsknangel
title: Just needs a few tweaks
content: I\'ve been on Twitter for a long time, and I have to commend Twitter for an overall, great social platform. However, with one of the more recent updates, they changed the notifications area in iPhone that allowed you to reply, retweet, or like a tweet when the phone was in a sleep mode or other app function. Loved that feature before they messed with it. Now it\'s much more difficult because it makes you open the app up from where you were, massively slowing down the process to respond - with the effect now of not wanting to respond at all when I get notifications. AND it erases all other notifications (that I want to go back to later) when you go to just ONE to respond- which REALLY makes me frustrated when I have to stay in the original app I was using. One other area of improvement would be to lessen the number of steps it takes to get to my profile, followers, etc. with the new updates, much more cumbersome.

author: julius casesar
title: Not cool
content: Twitter is overwhelmingly liberal. As the average app user is obviously young relative to the average American and the more unemployed you are the more time you have to curate your petty account and vent on twitter till you\'re blue in the face and still no solution is in sight, this does not surprise me. I appreciate the aspect of twitter that gives a platform to free speech, however a condensed, ignorant, and snarky version of free speech it usually turns out to be. That said, I\'m proud to give my opinion here, and I think it\'s a stupid app overall, adding to many pathetic people\'s stress levels and hatred levels against fellow Americans just like themselves. I could ignore all these people but twitter is always putting up hashtags and \"articles\", collections of tweets chosen for their liberalness and sheer ignorance which highlight and remind me of all my depressed, manic fellow twitter users. Thank goodness the real world is not like twitter.

author: Juan Guapo
title: Crippled, it still has poor AW support.
content:
Twitter is an excellent platform but the experience is marred by awful mobile apps.

First, a few features don\'t actually work on Apple Watch. They fix one thing, break another. Uninstall/reinstall/reboot doesn\'t help. In this last update, they fixed the New Tweet bug that kept it crashing but now RTs don\'t work--pity.

Next, for the iPhone itself, the interface was always a little clunky but the new \"interface\" they\'ve rolled out is very basic, muted, and in some ways user-hostile. Opening a particular twitter user\'s page is more-not-less-clicks than it was in the previous update. Drafting a new tweet looks cartoon-like. Yuck.

Lastly, they make it harder to like Twitter with almost every update. Instead of fixing bugs, slimming down the updates, and making the app perform faster/better and more reliably, they add more-and-more bloat. I keep two Twitter-related apps on my iPhone: their website link, and a 3rd party Twitter app (no name, except it rhymes with Terrific). 

I fear Twitter has lost its way.

I updated this app AND STILL getting the same \"show more tweets\" in the app. I open up the app after awhile (after 4+ hrs I\'d say) and it\'s there. author: SylvieBouvier
title: No Freedom of Speech
content: It use to be my favorite SM platform until My account that i had since 2008 was just suspended for so called twitter rule violations, with 40k followers non bought and many of them were my client! I read the twitter rules and i had violated none! I appealed to that silly support only to get the same email back "your account is suspended due to Twitter rule violation"  I checked 10 million times for those violations and I couldn't find any..  There is no real support!  Automated email, with the same answer! A lie in my case because no one bothered to check if i have violated rules.  Now,  Im on my 3rd account and im constantly being asked to verify my phone number!  i dont want to give Twitter my phone number! This is my personal private number out there for hackers to obtain.  You have no rights to demand my phone number!  With that number comes many more personal and private information!  Im in a process of getting attorney's advice!  Whats next my SSN!  The moment i RT @realdonaldtrump the biggest bully on social media, i have to change accounts because I will not provide Twitter with my phone number! No! What about my 1st amendment right and "freedom of speech" Now i hate twitter. All it does it gives me headache.

author: DREW B 🎉
title: update
content: yeah i never leave reviews for apps and i've never left a review for twitter bc its usually a good experience but after the new update i decided to write one. first off, the circles are ugly. they aren't "simple" or cute they're just ugly and no one likes them. second off the fade over the header makes it look weird when you try to use a white header. no one wants to see the date a person joined thats just embarrassing and ugly. also, you really need to make it to where people can download gifs and images easily because thats becoming a huge issue. another problem is that all videos are BLURRY. even if i were to upload a 720p video it still uploads to a blurrier version and it makes me want to rip my hair out. another issue, MAKE AN EDIT TWEET BUTTON. you really don't understand how frustrating it is to see a typo in a tweet you've posted and you really want to edit the tweet instead of having to delete it and retype it all over again. ANOTHER PROBLEM is that its really hard to tweet something important all in 140 characters. thats just cruel. and one of everyones biggest issues is the fact that you delete saved accounts that people keep to save @'s but you wont delete accounts that haven't been used since 2010. i really think u should look into this issue because its a big one. you should also stop shadowbanning people for swearing and start suspending accounts that use slurs against lgbtq+ communities, women, and people of color so that the twitter environment is safer. twitter has always been a place where i can make friends and connect with more people but i also like to have a nice layout and look while using the app and the update really ruined a lot. like you really updated the app just for the look but you didnt fix any of the issues that people have been asking you to fix FOR SO LONG. please look into these issues.

author: MarkTheWave
title: Request to Make the New iOS Twitter App Streamline User Interface VoiceOver Accessible
content:
Hello,

Recently, Twitter introduced a new, streamline, user interface in its iOS mobile app.

In the latest version of Twitter Mobile for iOS, if VoiceOver is not enabled prior to launching the app, the new streamline user interface, is displayed.  

However, if VoiceOver is enabled, prior to launching the app, the display reverts back to the classic interface.

Further, if VoiceOver is not enabled, prior to launching the app, then is enabled after the app is open, a dialogue box appears recommending that the user close and re-open the app with VoiceOver running, for best results.

I have tested the new interface with VoiceOver enabled and it is completely accessible.  So, effectively, all Twitter needs to do is to allow the new streamline UI to be the default interface when VoiceOver is running, at launch.

Please join me in requesting that the new streamline UI be the default interface when VoiceOver is enabled.

Thank you,

Mark

author: MarkTheWave
title: In Latest #iOS Twitter App, Cannot See All Members in My Created Members Lists, and 1 More Problem
content:
Hello, 

In the latest iOS Twitter app, I cannot see all members in my created members lists.  I Can only see 20 out of 60 members.  I can, however, see all of the members in a list when using a web browser.

I believe this is a bug that I request be addressed ASAP.

Steps to reproduce:
1.
From within the Twitter for iOS Mobile app, select the “Me” tab.

2.
Select Settings and Privacy.  A list of options will appear.

3.
Select Lists

4.
Select a created list consisting of more than 20 members.  In my case, I selected one such list that has 60 members.

5.
Near the top of the display, select the “Members” tab.

Now, a list of Twitter accounts will be displayed.  I can only see 20 accounts of the total 60.

Another issue I wish to address is that when VoiceOver, Apple’s software screen reading solution for the blind and low vision is enabled with the iOS Twitter app, when viewing quoted tweets, only the new text of the tweet can be read by VoiceOver.  The original text of the quoted tweet is simply spoken as “button.”  

While the VoiceOver-user can activate this button, in order to be taken to the original tweet, where it can be read by VoiceOver, there is no prompt indicating this functionality.  

I respectfully suggest that either (1) VoiceOver access to the original tweeted-text button be fixed so that it will be read, automatically or (2) instead of VoiceOver merely saying the word “button”, it be updated to say something like, “original tweet, button.”

Thank you,

Mark

author: timmc94
title: Terrible New Look
content:
Twitter recently announced a new look for their app, which they say is "simpler" and "looks better" but is actually the opposite of both. Common tasks take more steps now than they used to, the UI is primitive and ugly, and it has dramatically decreased my interest in the platform in the course of less than 48 hours. It makes using the app more complicated and less fun… especially when you have multiple accounts added to the app that you frequently switch between. If the sidebar was removed on iPhone and it ran the way it does on iPad (with a profile tab, the way it used to be) it would at least be tolerable… but that's not the case. Way to go, Twitter. *slow clap*

In other, older news: the annoying "Explore" tab is still here and hasn't gotten any better. Twitter attracts all kinds of users; Personally, I don't care about 90% of what ANY social app puts in their "Explore" section… for example, Instagram's "Explore" tab is full of accounts fishing for likes and reposting other people's content, which I am not interested in and leads me to roll my eyes every time I go to search for something in the search bar that shares that page. Now Twitter is doing the same thing: not only is search moving from its nice place in the upper right, but it's taking up a tab on the TabBar and is just full of Tweets that I have zero interest in. I'd rather just have search separate from that tab and have the option to disable this new "Explore" tab because it is of zero use to me aside from the fact that it is now where search resides.

Twitter as a service is awesome, and is my favorite social network which I believe is drastically underrated. I hope they fix the horrible changes they've been making lately, or they're only going to worsen their condition! I have an older version of the app on my computer, which I may just sync over to do away with this terrible new UI as long as I can still use Twitter. That's how bad it is.

Tip for users with multiple accounts: on iPhone (or iPod touch) you can switch accounts in one step by tapping and holding on your profile picture in the upper left. This isn't exactly the most intuitive shortcut ever, but it's at least better than the usual method. If possible, I recommend using this app on an iPad instead.

author: TumbleBumbleatNight
title: Came back after years of using a third-party app
content:
For years, I used a third-party twitter app. However, in the last few months, I've found myself also needing to use the official app because of its more robust search features and due to bugs in third-party apps. I finally made the decision to fully switch to the official twitter app and I'm very pleased. The UI is nice, it's easy to follow conversations/threads, and I like how I'm now able to easily switch between multiple accounts. 

A few suggestions for improvement to make this a 5-star app:

- make it easier to switch night mode on and off. I use both modes and would love to have a simple gesture or action on the screen that allows me to make this switch. 

- show tweets in chronological order! 

- give users a paid option to remove ads. I'm completely happy paying for a nice app that also allows me to remove annoying ads, as I think are many users.

Edit: Thank you for adding the ability to switch night mode on and off so easily! Love it! Overall, this really is the best option for Twitter if you're a heavy Twitter user.

author: timmc94
title: New "Explore" Tab
content:
I love Twitter, and I love the Twitter app. But a few updates ago they introduced something that really bothers me, which is still around…this new "Explore" tab.

Twitter attracts all kinds of users. Personally, I don't care about 90% of what ANY social app puts in their "Explore" section… for example, Instagram's "Explore" tab is full of accounts fishing for likes and reposting other people's content, which I am not interested in and leads me to roll my eyes every time I go to search for something in the search bar that shares that page.

Now Twitter is doing the same thing: not only is search moving from its nice place in the upper right, but it's taking up a tab on the TabBar and is just full of Tweets that I have zero interest in. I'd rather just have search separate from that tab and have the option to disable this new "Explore" tab because it is of zero use to me aside from the fact that it is now where search resides.

Oh, and the new redesign that is meant to simplify things just makes most tasks more complicated; especially if you have multiple accounts in the app to switch between, which had a super-simple shortcut before that you can't use anymore.

title: Gross negligence
content:
They refuse to acknowledge obvious harassment, including revealing personal information of their users by other users, even when that information puts a user at risk of physical danger. I do not ever advise that transgender people who do not wish to have their dead name/gender discussed to use this site.
I imagine that those who are under witness protection or otherwise do no want sensitive information shared publicly, should stay away from Twitter.

Any attempt to report harassment is met with nonchalant, generic, copy and paste responses. 

Twitter also refused to acknowledge my attempts to contact them to have my account deleted due to feeling unsafe.

They do not care about their users at all.

It is also riddled with advertisements, every 3-4 posts in my feed is an advertisement, which is obnoxious and makes the experience of using their app painfully lacking.

I can't even use twitter in safari because it automatically goes to the app, which doesn't work at all for me. Hopefully a update will release soon, one that doesn't try to sign people in to specific accounts, after re-downloading. I don't want twitter to "assume" who downloaded the app. Just let me sign into the app myself, so this doesn't ever happen.

Stuff is supposed to be convenient. Right now, it isn't.
